error.signature: error: cannot rebase: You have unstaged changes. Please commit or stash them.

verdict.summary: Git refuses to rebase because there are uncommitted changes in the working tree. Rebase rewrites commits and needs a clean working directory to avoid losing changes.

dead_ends.action: Using git checkout . to discard all changes before rebase
dead_ends.why_fails: This permanently deletes all uncommitted work. If the changes were important, they are lost forever with no way to recover.

dead_ends.action: Using git rebase --force or --no-verify to bypass the check
dead_ends.why_fails: There is no --force flag for git rebase that bypasses the dirty working tree check. --no-verify only skips hooks, not the clean tree requirement.

workarounds.action: Stash changes, rebase, then pop the stash
workarounds.how:
git stash
git rebase origin/main
git stash pop
# If stash pop has conflicts:
git stash drop  # after resolving manually

workarounds.action: Commit the changes as a WIP commit, rebase, then soft reset
workarounds.how:
git add -A && git commit -m 'WIP: save before rebase'
git rebase origin/main
git reset --soft HEAD~1
# Your changes are now staged again, rebase is done

leads_to.condition: After stashing and rebasing, conflicts occur during rebase

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'cannot rebase: unstaged changes' blocks the rebase from starting. 'local changes would be overwritten by merge' occurs during merge/pull when specific files conflict.
